flawed_nl_solution:
After the increase, he can lift 300+50=<<300+50=350>>350 pounds
Decreasing the distance increase the amount he can lift by 350*0.3=<<350*0.3=105>>105 pounds
So he can lift 350+105=<<350+105=455>>455 for 10 feet
The straps add another 455*0.2=<<455*0.2=19>>19 pounds
So his total weight is 455+19=<<455+19=474>>474 pounds per hand
#### 474

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 91, not 19. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
